Class GameNode

java.lang.Object
project.common.AbstractObservableField
project.common.GameNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observable, ToolField
public class GameNode extends AbstractObservableField
The GameNode class represents a node in the game grid, which could be a part of a wire, a bulb, or a power source. It keeps track of its position, the sides it connects to, and whether it is powered on or off. This class extends AbstractObservableField, meaning it can notify observers about its state changes.

      Constructor for creating a GameNode with a specific position, type, and sides.
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the node.
      col - The column of the node.
      type - The type of the node (e.g., BULB, WIRE, SOURCE).
      sides - The sides this node connects to.

    • containsConnector

      public boolean containsConnector(Side s)
      Checks if the node contains a specific connector (side).
      Parameters:
      s - The side to check for a connector (e.g., NORTH, EAST, etc.).
      Returns:
      true if the node contains the specified connector, otherwise false.

    • getNumberOfSides

      public int getNumberOfSides()
      Returns the number of sides the node has.
      Returns:
      The number of sides.

    • turn

      public void turn()
      Rotates the sides of the node 90 degrees clockwise. This changes the direction of all the connectors and updates the number of turns.

    • turnReverse

      public void turnReverse()
      Rotates the node counterclockwise by one step. This method shifts each side of the node 270 degrees clockwise (equivalent to one counterclockwise rotation). It then decrements the number of rotations performed, reorders the sides to a fixed directional order (NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST), and notifies all observers about the state change.

    • light

      public boolean light()
      Returns whether the node is powered or not.
      Returns:
      true if the node is powered, otherwise false.

    • getNumberOfTurns

      public int getNumberOfTurns()
      Returns the number of turns, considering the type of sides the node has.
      Returns:
      The number of turns (either 0 or 1 based on the sides).

    • getTurns

      public int getTurns()
      Returns the number of times the node has been rotated.
      Returns:
      the number of rotations performed on the node.

    • getType

      public NodeType getType()
      Returns the type of the node (e.g., BULB, WIRE, SOURCE).
      Returns:
      The type of the node.

    • setPowered

      public void setPowered(boolean powered)
      Sets the power state of the node.
      Parameters:
      powered - true to power on the node, false to power it off.

    • getSides

      public Side[] getSides()
      Returns the sides that the node connects to.
      Returns:
      The sides (e.g., north, south, east, west).

    • isPowered

      public boolean isPowered()
      Returns whether the node is powered.
      Returns:
      true if the node is powered, otherwise false.
